programme.title: Prince Philip: The Plot to Make a King
programme.desc: Secret History documentary telling the inside story of the dynastic tensions that were unleashed when Princess Elizabeth, the future queen, fell in love with Prince Philip. It was felt that Philip was rough and ill-mannered - and with the Second World War still fresh in most people's minds, the royal and political elite disliked his German roots. But following the death of King George VI in 1952, the establishment feared a dynastic coup, with the Queen torn between the two sides. The documentary examines the complexities and frustrations of the royal marriage, as the monarch struggled to reconcile the love of her husband with the suspicions of her family and her government.

programme.desc: A road traffic accident turns into a drugs investigation when a quantity of cocaine is found in the crashed vehicle. The driver is dead, but Yvonne is more interested in his passenger, none other than Shirley Moss, who's suffered two broken legs. However, when she begins to question the errant teenager about her continued involvement in drugs, Yvonne soon has reason to believe the youngster isn't the architect of her own downfall - especially after the PC's sister, Beverley, is spotted entering a dealer's flat being staked out by Ken and Suzie. Elsewhere, Mark is upset that his colleagues in SO19 have discovered he is gay, but with the secret now out he throws caution to the wind and decides to take his relationship with Lance one step further - it looks like Sun Hill is about to witness its first gay wedding. programme.desc: Jim sinks to a new low when he pawns valuable police evidence to raise the cash he needs to pay off his gambling debts - then promptly blows the lot on a horse. Andrea refuses to abandon her undercover assignment even though Adam is getting uncomfortably close to the truth. Smithy finds the sniper's rifle and it appears to be only a matter of time before the culprit is finally caught - but not everything is as it seems.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: A road traffic accident turns into a drugs investigation when a quantity of cocaine is found in the crashed vehicle. The driver is dead, but Yvonne is more interested in his passenger, none other than Shirley Moss, who's suffered two broken legs. However, when she begins to question the errant teenager about her continued involvement in drugs, Yvonne soon has reason to believe the youngster isn't the architect of her own downfall - especially after the PC's sister, Beverley, is spotted entering a dealer's flat being staked out by Ken and Suzie. Elsewhere, Mark is upset that his colleagues in SO19 have discovered he is gay, but with the secret now out he throws caution to the wind and decides to take his relationship with Lance one step further - it looks like Sun Hill is about to witness its first gay wedding. With romance in the air, the Christmas party gets into full swing, and new girl Amber certainly enjoys herself - and causes much gossip - by very publicly kissing one of the barm.

programme.title: Hetty Wainthropp Investigates
programme.desc: The sleuthing housewife investigates a spiritualist who appears to be blackmailing her customers, while Geoffrey falls in love, but his secret romance threatens to undermine Hetty's carefully laid trap - and nearly causes him to quit the agency.

programme.title: Hetty Wainthropp Investigates
programme.sub-title: A Rose by Any Other Name
programme.desc: A middle-aged widow's family become convinced a photographer is only marrying her for money and ask Hetty to investigate. Given a week to probe his past and find out whether he's a gold-digging cad or a 24-carat gentleman, the unlikely sleuth unearths some extremely interesting facts. Drama based on the novel by David Cook, starring Patricia Routledge and Derek Benfield.

programme.title: Catherine Cookson's The Rag Nymph
programme.desc: Feature-length period melodrama set in Victorian times, charting the relationship between feisty Newcastle rag-woman Aggie Winkowski and 10-year-old orphan Millie Forester. Determined to protect Millie from the seamy world of prostitution, Aggie resolves to take the youngster under her wing. Starring Honeysuckle Weeks, Perdita Weeks, Val McLane, Alec Newman, Crispin Bonham-Carter and Patrick Ryecart.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: The nuns and midwives of Nonnatus House return, with new nurse Barbara, who is anxious to prove herself - only to get off on the wrong foot after a late-night drinks party. A family of severely neglected children is discovered, so Trixie strives to restore their health and bring happiness into their lives, leaving Tom filled with admiration for the woman he loves, while Sister Evangelina finally undergoes tests for her abdominal pains. Shelagh finds she is at the surgery almost as much as she is at home, so the Turners come up with a solution which, for 1960, proves somewhat ground-breaking.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Barbara faces her most challenging case so far when she treats a first-time mother, only for the birth not to go according to plan. A new nurse arrives and soon makes an impression on Sister Evangelina, while Sister Julienne is worried about the increasing financial pressure on Nonnatus House, but doesn't bank on a mystery benefactor coming to the rescue. Jenny Agutter and Pam Ferris star, with Linda Bassett (East Is East) joining the cast.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The squad reinvestigates the death of a timeshare magnate, previously thought to have committed suicide, when a reformed call girl claims she was with him the night he died and saw someone force their way into his house as she left. It then emerges the deceased's widow has since fallen on hard times after being swindled by her late husband's business partner - who is connected to a notorious criminal. Guest starring Shane Richie, Naomi Bentley and Claire Rushbrook.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Nikki, Jack, Thomas and Clarissa are just settling down for their respective Christmas Day celebrations when they are called in to investigate a shooting spree at an enormous property owned by Andy McMorris, the CEO of a haulage company. Emilia Fox stars.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Boyd learns he is being removed from the Cold Case unit. For his final job, he re-opens an investigation into the disappearance of 16 homeless teenagers between 1979 and 1982 - the first case he ever worked on. However, as the team struggles to find any new information, Grace worries about her colleague's reasons for revisiting his past - while a guilt-ridden Sarah becomes desperate to make amends for her role in Boyd's sacking. First part of the crime drama's two-part final story, starring Trevor Eve, with Paul McGann.

programme.title: Tess of the D'Urbervilles
programme.desc: Peasant girl Tess Durbeyfield is encouraged by her father to seek advancement with their supposed relatives, the wealthy D'Urbervilles, and meets the charming Alec, man of the house since his father's death. He showers her with attention and gifts, promising her family will want for nothing - but as she soon discovers to her cost, there's a dark side to her persistent new suitor. Thomas Hardy adaptation, starring Gemma Arterton, Hans Matheson, Ian Puleston-Davies and Anna Massey.

programme.title: Doctor Finlay
programme.desc: Dr Cameron's work at the German PoW camp brings him into conflict with one of the prisoners, while Janet fears Dr Finlay's affection for a married patient could jeopardise his career. Medical drama, starring David Rintoul, Ian Bannen and Annette Crosbie.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Bramwell
programme.desc: Wealthy widow Alice Costigan invites Robert to stay at her country house for a spot of pheasant shooting, filling him with high hopes of romance. However, he's not the only one vying for her affections, and when her nephew falls ill she snubs him by turning to his rival for help. Victorian medical drama, starring Jemma Redgrave, David Calder, Maureen Beattie and Andrew Connolly.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: As the regiment prepares to leave for the South Atlantic to defend Deliverance Island, Andy contemplates proposing, and Sarah and Jeremy's relationship begins to crumble.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: It's a difficult day for Yvonne as she faces up to the fact that she was wrong to throw Shirley out of the house. However, the youngster eventually accepts her apology and it looks as if, once she has pulled through this latest mishap, the kindly PC will be able to get her life back on track - until fate deals a terrible blow. Meanwhile, with the tensions in his relationship with Andrea beginning to take their toll, Neil is devastated at the news that she has been critically injured. He turns up at the hospital, only to be faced by Smithy, having already filled his shoes. Lance finally accepts Mark's proposal of marriage after a long day of deliberation, while Gina is surprised to catch a glimpse of Irene Radford. She is convinced her eyes are deceiving her - until Jack confides in her that Sun Hill's crime matriarch is indeed back. Michele Austin, Andrew Lancel, Simon Rouse, Roberta Taylor, Lynda Bellingham and Stefan Booth star.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Mark decides to leave when he realises neither Tricia nor Chrissie want him around - but an encounter with a patient could change their minds. Donna applies for a bar job, and persuades Mickie to lie to the manager about her experience. Mubbs gets a wake-up call when Owen decides not to let him be best man, and Sean offers to stand by Jess.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Kate's anxiety over her financial woes spills over into work, Richard and George clash over treatment of patients, and Jack advises Richard to take it easy because of his multiple sclerosis. A young couple come to blows, driven to their wits' end by their baby's crying.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Having discovered Irene Radford is back, Gina is determined to put her old enemy behind bars once and for all - and the two are soon face to face again when an intruder at the Radford house turns out to be Irene herself, who claims she has returned because she is critically ill with cancer. However, the police have got wind that she is plotting one final raid before retiring from a life of crime for good, so Phil is tasked to monitor a prison meeting between Irene and her son David, where the top brass are hoping he'll glean valuable information about the job. Unfortunately, the philandering DS is easily distracted by an old flame working at the prison and misses half the conversation - so when the raid gets under way, it soon becomes clear they've been duped, and a senior officer ends up staring down the barrel of Irene's gun. Back at the station, Honey is upset to learn that Amber has taken the 'shy and sensitive' Steve Hunter's virginity, while Sam seems to be warming to Phil. Is ro.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: The highs and lows of life with the residents of Albert Square, Walford.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Mark is in for a shock.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: A drug war leads to a fire in a block of flats in a nearby estate. Meanwhile, Sicknote gives a public speech which leads to him receiving a standing ovation.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: A friend who runs a fairground asks Lovejoy to sell silver candlesticks on his behalf, but the police arrive and reveal they are stolen property. Jimmy Jewel and Phil Daniels guest star, with Ian McShane and Dudley Sutton.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Animal rights activists free a group of monkeys, one of which is carrying a lethal and contagious virus, so Jim tries to contain the infection before Jersey is struck by an epidemic. John Nettles stars.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Grandad receives a valuable present from Jack and Adrian for his 75th birthday, while Joey is reunited with his long-lost dog.

programme.title: Are You Being Served?
programme.desc: Mr Spooner reveals unexpected musical abilities - and the rest of the staff, astonished to discover he has any talent at all, insist on cashing in on his chart success. Mike Berry, John Inman, Frank Thornton, Wendy Richard and Mollie Sugden star in the final episode of the long-running shopfloor comedy, which features a guest appearance by former Crimewatch presenter Nick Ross.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: A Hollywood producer arrives in town, full of big ideas about filming one of Lionel's books - but his plan to use authentic locations is met with disapproval. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Barry in Danger from Reading and Aunt Jessie
programme.desc: Nora Batty spots Alvin with a mystery woman, and convinces herself that the couple are becoming close after some devious work by the elderly Lothario and a blushing Billy. Pearl spots a lonely hearts advertisement that she is sure is from Howard. Kathy Staff, Brian Murphy and Keith Clifford star.

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: The duo investigate the murder of a solicitor in a sleepy Yorkshire village, but grumpy detective Dalziel finds himself personally involved when a letter addressed to him is discovered among the victim's belongings. Drama, starring Warren Clarke and Colin Buchanan as the chalk-and-cheese detectives.

credits.actor: Colin Buchanan as the chalk-and-cheese detectives

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: A dying man asks the team to clear the name of his son, a talented junior golfer who committed suicide after being implicated in the murder of a 10-year-old boy. Aiding the investigation is a former chief superintendent who admits she always had doubts about the teenager's guilt, but the committee members of the exclusive golf club where the victim's body was discovered prove reluctant to help the officers with their inquiries. Isla Blair and Cherie Lunghi guest star.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: A dying man's last desperate answerphone message confuses the police and hampers their investigation into his murder. Adding to the air of mystery surrounding the case, it also sets his son off on a nightmare journey. Glasgow-set detective drama, starring Mark McManus, James Macpherson, Blythe Duff, Iain Anders, Harriet Buchan and Robert Robertson.

programme.title: Bramwell
programme.desc: Marsham learns his wife has breast cancer and tries to make amends for neglecting her, shelving a planned move to Scotland and begging Robert and Eleanor to perform a life-saving operation. Medical drama, starring Jemma Redgrave and David Calder.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: A remote British-ruled island in the South Pacific is invaded and the King's Own Fusiliers find themselves part of the task force sent to retake it. Unfortunately, Corporal Hobbs is soon captured and tortured by enemy troops, and Colonel Eastwood's daring plan of attack has explosive consequences.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Having discovered Irene Radford is back, Gina is determined to put her old enemy behind bars once and for all - and the two are soon face to face again when an intruder at the Radford house turns out to be Irene herself, who claims she has returned because she is critically ill with cancer. Back at the station, Honey is upset to learn that Amber has taken the 'shy and sensitive' Steve Hunter's virginity, while Sam seems to be warming to Phil. Is ro.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: On a busy night behind the bar, Mickie notices Jodie is becoming breathless and feverish, and tries to persuade her to seek medical help. Tricia and Mark find working together tense, but agree to be as professional as possible, while Diane suffers from pre-wedding jitters and turns to Ric for support. Her fears may be well-founded, as Owen's stag night ends with him kissing Chrissie.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Mark and George treat a youngster who has suffered an epileptic fit, while in something of a quandary having spent the night together. A family dispute culminates in a reckless car chase and horrific crash, while Baz misses Charlie's presence.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Following the Radford family's botched attempt to spring David from prison, Irene drives off with Gina at gunpoint and forces the inspector to let her colleagues know she means business. If they don't give up the chase, she won't hesitate to pull the trigger. Soon, Gina finds herself alone with her enemy, and as they begin to talk, the two of them realise they understand one another better than they could possibly have imagined. However, when Irene orders the shooting of Jack Gaunt, it becomes clear Gina is still in very real danger. Meanwhile, Honey has it out with Steve, disappointed that he had sex with Amber, and accusing him of being as bad as his brother. Indeed, Phil is having his fair share of problems as Sam discovers that his New Year's invitation followed hard on the heels of his dalliance with the prison liaison officer. Roberta Taylor, Lynda Bellingham, Lisa Maxwell and Scott Maslen star.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Pete takes time off to treat Christine to a day at the races, Mandy is the subject of gossip in the Square, and Dot interferes in Mark's life and gives Hattie shocking new.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: PatCabs needs another driver, Rachel and Kathy grab some bargains at the jumble sale, and Michelle gets a job offer. Sharon is impressed with Grant's hard work at the Vic.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Blue Watch are called to a DHSS office where a distressed claimant has covered himself in petrol and set himself alight. Starring Glen Murphy.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.sub-title: Never Judge a Book by Its Cover
programme.desc: While searching a Cambridge antiques fair for religious books with Charlotte and Charlie Gimbert, Lovejoy discovers a rare Bible that seems to offer a solution to all his problems. Meanwhile, Tinker has a hard time persuading Beth's father that she should carry on working for such a rogue. Drama, guest starring Richard Briers and James Ellis, with Ian McShane.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Jim goes against his better judgement to help Philippa Vale - aka the Ice Maiden - discover who is trying to kill her. Drama, guest starring Liza Goddard, with John Nettles and Terence Alexander.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Freddie loses a valuable ring, while Jack, who found it and tried to pawn it, is filled with remorse. Meanwhile, Adrian shocks the family with his radical change in personality, insisting on being called Jimmy. Comedy, starring Jonathon Morris, Ronald Forfar, Victor McGuire and Jean Boht.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.sub-title: Desire in the Mickey Mouse Grotto
programme.desc: One of the yellowcoat's professionalism is questioned by a sharp-eyed passer-by who spots her entering a staff chalet late at night. With Simon Cadell, Ruth Madoc and Gillian Taylforth.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean accepts Lionel's proposal, but their happiness is not shared by everyone. Sandy walks out on her boyfriend while Stephen tries to organise a surprise party for Penny.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Who's That Merry Man with Billy, Then?
programme.desc: After recruitment for his Merry Men hits an all-time low, a letter from an enthusiast with excellent credentials gets Billy excited again, and he organises a committee to greet the newest member. Long-running comedy, starring Keith Clifford and Peter Sallis.

programme.title: Judge John Deed
programme.desc: Jo Mills takes on the case of a worker killed on a building site, convinced that the managing director of the company should be held accountable for his neglect of health and safety legislation. However, the Lord Chancellor's department once again try to divert the course of justice to avoid embarrassment - and Deed's ex-wife is appointed counsel for the defence. Legal drama, starring Martin Shaw and Jenny Seagrove.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The discovery of a bloodstained pair of hot pants results in the team being asked to reinvestigate the 1971 disappearance of a mother and her six-month-old son. Lane, who worked on the original case, quickly identifies the victim's husband as the chief suspect, but when Halford and Standing learn two other women went missing in the area on the same day, they suspect they are looking for a serial killer. Amanda Redman stars.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: A war begins between rival taxi firms, confronting the team with a series of coincidences to investigate, and Taggart's family problems are compounded when his daughter is implicated in a murder investigation. Glasgow-set detective drama, with Mark McManus, James MacPherson and Blythe Duff. Directed by series regular Alan Macmillan, who also worked on The Bill and Ballykissangel. The supporting cast includes Iain Anders, Robert Robertson, Stewart Preston, Harriet Buchan, Leigh Biagi, Andy McEwan and Peter O'Brien.

programme.title: Bramwell
programme.desc: Eleanor is flattered by the attentions of charming Dr Hunter, at least on first impressions, but soon changes her opinion when his housekeeper dies suddenly.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Butcher celebrates his forthcoming wedding to Stacey with a riotous stag party in France, but finds Continental hospitality losing its allure after a transport strike strands him on the wrong side of the Channel. While Steve Evans pulls out all the stops to get his friend to the church on time, Dr Sarah Eastwood faces an agonising romantic dilemma and Chris comes to a momentous decision.

Roberta Taylor, Lynda Bellingham, Lisa Maxwell and Scott Maslen star.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: As the day of the wedding dawns, Chrissie and Owen wake up together. But while she is convinced this means he won't go through with marrying Diane, she is soon disabused of this notion when he dismisses the previous night as a drunken mistake. Tricia ends up becoming everybody's confidante, and Jodie is rushed to hospital after she collapses at Mickie's house. Connie discovers her condition is caused by a disastrous old operation, and ends up having to remove her lung. The tense situation is complicated further when it emerges Jodie and Will have a history together.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: A young rollerblade hockey player is coy about how he received his mysterious injuries, Liz's boyfriend leaves her for another woman, and Tina acts beyond the call of duty when she contacts Social Services about an injured boy.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Staff shortages cause tension in CPU, with Ramani bearing the brunt as she struggles to cope with an increased workload - and when an outside source brings the matter to Adam's attention, the situation becomes hugely political, only serving to aggravate the already volatile relationship between Jack and Neil. By way of an immediate solution, Jack assigns Terry to help Ramani with the case of a man suspected of being a paedophile - but Ramani is worried about Terry's ability to deal with such a task given his own traumatic background. Meanwhile, the rest of the relief let their hair down at Lance's stag party - but when the guest of honour nips outside for a breath of fresh air, he is suddenly attacked from behind by a group who put a bag over his head and bundle him into the back of a van. It could just be a stag night prank - or it could be something more serious. Guest starring Annabelle Apsion and Colm O'Maonlai.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Mandy tries to persuade Mark to let her stay in the squat. Ian's dishonesty catches up with him, while Arthur plays detective to track down his garden gnome.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Two birthdays in the Fowler family; Pete is the life and soul of Martin's party, but will an unwelcome guest ruin Michelle's?.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: A window cleaner gets his arm trapped in a cradle mechanism at the top of a tower block, and Sicknote is sent over the edge to rescue him.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: A romantic weekend in the country turns sour for Charlotte and Lovejoy when one of her friends takes a shine to him. Matters deteriorate further for the dodgy dealer when he learns Charlie is trying to evict his business. Light-hearted drama, starring Ian McShane, Caroline Langrishe and Malcolm Tierney.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Jim experiences complications while conducting an investigation into the disappearance of a financier. John Nettles stars.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Lilo Lill turns up on the doorstep, Joey meets Roxy, Adrian buys something really stupid and Aveline is insulted by a photographer.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.desc: The staff try to stop Ted celebrating his birthday every two weeks in a bid to con gifts and free drinks out of gullible holiday-makers. Meanwhile, there may be trouble ahead when the runner-up in the Holiday Princess competition is spotted entering a staff chalet at night. Comedy, starring Paul Shane and Su Pollard.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: The announcement of Jean and Lionel's wedding date gives the neighbourhood women the perfect opportunity to go shopping for new outfits - until the bride-to-be is accused of shoplifting. Comedy, with Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Lenny hears a voice from above, and decides he must wait patiently for more information, leaving the gang to make sure he is well-equipped to receive messages. Comedian Bobby Ball returns as the gullible pickle factory worker, with Peter Sallis and Frank Thornton.

programme.title: Hetty Wainthropp Investigates
programme.desc: The sleuth tries to help a road rage victim, but lands right in the middle of a family tragedy she may be unable to control. Hetty tries to fix the missing pieces of the puzzle into place and her client gets a very unexpected result.

programme.title: Ms Fisher's Modern Murder Mysteries
programme.desc: Part one of two. After two pop singers are electrocuted while performing on a TV music show, Peregrine's impartiality is tested when an old boyfriend is named as the lead suspect in the case. Geraldine Hakewill stars.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The squad is ordered by its new boss to look into the unsolved murder of a barrister found bound and gagged in his car 25 years ago. The case was a rare failure for a former chief inspector, although his notes point to a very clear suspect. As they uncover the late advocate's unusual hobbies, they gradually learn exactly what happened. Anita Dobson, Jenny Agutter and Keith Barron guest star.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: An informant is due to give evidence against his former boss, one of Glasgow's most powerful gang leaders - but police fail to get the witness to court. Drama, with Mark McManus, Blythe Duff and James MacPherson. Co-star Gray O'Brien makes one of six appearances in the series, years before playing Tony Gordon in Coronation Street. More recently he popped up in The Loch, and Shakespeare & Hathaway: Private Investigators. Director Richard Holthouse went on to helm several episodes of Midsomer Murders.

programme.desc: Vanessa warns Rhona over something, Luke finds himself in an awkward position with Victoria, and a secret is revealed.

programme.title: Tonight
programme.sub-title: Deadly Virus: Is Britain Prepared? Tonight
programme.desc: Health experts from around the globe are concerned about the coronavirus, which has originated in China and could destroy many lives. But will it take hold in the UK? Ranvir Singh investigates.

programme.title: Inside the Crown: Secrets of the Royals
programme.desc: The documentary focuses on the royals' rollercoaster relationship with the press, beginning with the Queen's 1953-1954 Commonwealth tour, when cameramen worked hand-in-hand with the palace. A few years later, newspaper owner Lord Altrincham was attacked for daring to publish criticisms of the Queen, but by the mid-1970s Princess Margaret's hedonistic lifestyle was the subject of increasing press attention. But that was only the beginning. In the 1990s, the press has a field day over the breakdown of Charles and Diana's marriage, feeding on royal scandals.

programme.title: Save Money: Lose Weight
programme.desc: Sian Williams and Ranj Singh present the consumer health show. Volunteers help put two more diets through their paces - the Eat What You Like & Lose Weight for Life cook book and Noom, an app that has been trending worldwide. How will they rank on the leaderboard? Also, Sian test a new super grain, pea milk and a vegetable sheeter, and Ranj investigates technology and gadgets that are designed to boost willpower when it comes to dieting.

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: Will and Ellie go on their first date with a trip to the flicks. However, a scream from the projection booth cuts the romance short as they discover a brutal murder has taken place within the cinema. Geordie arrives to investigate and soon they've found movie star connections, oddball employees and a link to the Asian subcontinent, as a shadowy figure emerges from Jack Chapman's past and refuses to retreat without causing a stir. Cathy's mother takes the children out for the day, which ends up worrying Cathy far more than it should. Robson Green, Tom Brittney, Lauren Carse and Kacey Ainsworth star.

programme.title: Who's Doing the Dishes?
programme.desc: Former Big Brother winner Josie Gibson puts on a dinner party at her home as she plays mystery host to four strangers. Presented by Brian McFadden.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Maria is shocked to hear that Daniel failed to have Bertie vaccinated, while Sally returns and is horrified to realise everyone knows Tim's a bigamist. As Alya assures Yasmeen that her drinking is fine, Geoff does his best to undermine her confidence.

programme.title: The Greek Islands with Julia Bradbury
programme.desc: Known as the Paradise Islands, the Sporades' lush pine forests and coastlines are simply breathtaking. On Skiathos, Julia boards a fishing boat in search of a secret world of hidden coves and deserted beaches. Heading inland, she visits the hillside Monastery of Evangelistria, one of Greece's most important religious sites, before island-hopping to neighbouring Skopelos for a taste of marriage, Greek style. After trying on the island's traditional wedding dress, her trip ends at the tiny Chapel of St John.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: After waking from a nap, Daniel confuses Bethany for Sinead, and kisses her. Geoff continues to spread lies about Yasmeen's drinking, while Steve and Tracy are railroaded into attending Ken's book club as part of their relationship-building exercise.

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: When a young man is found dead and stark naked out on the Fens, Will and Geordie discover ties to a Cambridge research project experimenting with mind-altering drugs. Its arrogant professor is a proponent of the drug LSD in his psychotherapy sessions, but Will and Geordie start wondering whether there is more going on. As the case proceeds, Will's feelings of guilt about his father's death and his conflicted feelings about Ellie start to take their toll. Elsewhere, the Keatings suffer an awkward dinner party and the Chapman feud shows no sign of relenting. Robson Green and Tom Brittney star.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.sub-title: Brexit Live: An ITV News Special
programme.desc: Tom Bradby is joined by special guests in the studio, and ITV News presenters and correspondents around the country, for the countdown to the historic moment the UK leaves the European Union. Tonight's event comes after three extensions and three-and-a-half years following the referendum on the issue of continued membership. Plus, the day's other national and international headlines..

programme.title: Cold Feet
programme.desc: Adam reaches out to Laura, but risks upsetting his family as a result, while Karen and Jenny's weekend away is hijacked by their mothers. Pete's attempts to reunite the Three Amigos ends in disaster. John Thomson, James Nesbitt, Fay Ripley, Hermione Norris and Robert Bathurst star in Mike Bullen's long-running comedy drama, with Sacha Parkinson, Gemma Jones, Clare Keelan and Sunetra Sarker.

programme.title: Through the Keyhole
programme.desc: Comedian Jimmy Carr, TV and radio presenter Eamonn Holmes, and former Gogglebox star Scarlett Moffatt form the celebrity panel, Keith Lemon ventures into the homes of three more mystery stars. Once inside, he points out telltale clues that might hint at the identity of each property's occupant, and challenges his studio panellists to guess 'who habitates in a house like this?'.

programme.title: Living on the Veg
programme.desc: Henry Firth serves up his father's paella, he and Ian Theasby bake a Victoria sponge and they are joined by Day Radley, founder of the Vegan Chef School, who demonstrates her beetroot ravioli. Henry and Ian also show how to jazz up home-made houmous and make a Texan-style pizza, with spiced tofu and bourbon sauce.

programme.title: Save Money: Lose Weight
programme.desc: Sian Williams and Ranj Singh present the consumer health show. How will they rank on the leaderboard? Also, Sian test a new super grain, pea milk and a vegetable sheeter, and Ranj investigates technology and gadgets that are designed to boost willpower when it comes to dieting.

programme.title: Dancing on Ice
programme.desc: The celebrities and their professional partners perform yet again, hoping to get a high score from the judges - not to mention plenty of viewer votes - and avoid following Trisha Goddard and Lucrezia Millarini in being eliminated from the contest. And while the votes are being counted, Jane Torvill and Christopher Dean take to the ice to show the contestants how it should be done. Presented by Phillip Schofield and Holly Willoughby.

programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: Ireland v Scotland (Kick-off 4.45pm). Coverage from the Aviva Stadium in Dublin, where Andy Farrell takes charge of his first Six Nations match as head coach of Ireland. The sides will be perfectly familiar with each other, having met in the pool stage of the World Cup in Japan in September, when Ireland came out on top 27-3 in a relatively one-sided encounter. However, both teams were to come a cropper at the hands of the host nation, meaning elimination for Scotland and a quarter-final against New Zealand for the Irish, in which they were comprehensively outplayed. The Scots still have Gregor Townsend at the helm, with the pressure on the former fly-half to harness the undoubted talent that his squad possesses into positive results. Mark Pougatch presents, with analysis from Jonny Wilkinson, Brian O'Driscoll and Ian McGeechan, pitchside reports by Martin Bayfield, and commentary from Nick Mullins, Scott Hastings and Gordon D'Arcy.

programme.title: The Masked Singer
programme.desc: Joel Dommett hosts a special double elimination show, in which two more singers will be unmasked. Sharon and Kelly Osbourne are today's special guests on the panel, joining series regulars Rita Ora, Jonathan Ross and Davina McCall as they attempt to guess the identities of the six famous faces performing from behind bizarre costumes.

programme.title: The Voice UK
programme.desc: The blind auditions enter their fifth week, as coaches will.i.am, Sir Tom Jones, Meghan Trainor and Olly Murs continue their search for the next singing superstar. The acts will be hoping to secure a place on a coach's team and take a step closer to winning a life-changing record deal.

programme.title: Shopping with Keith Lemon
programme.desc: Keith takes 1980s pop icon Matt Goss from Bros shopping around Mayfair, and 2018 I'm a Celebrity runner-up Emily Atack in search of a new bed.

programme.title: American Sniper (2014)
programme.desc: A Navy Seal becomes a legend to his colleagues thanks to his skills as a deadly sniper. On his return to the US following four tours of duty in Iraq, he finds living an ordinary life as a husband and father far more difficult to deal with than the demands of warfare. Biopic based on the experiences of real-life Iraq conflict veteran Chris Kyle, directed by Clint Eastwood and starring Bradley Cooper, Sienna Miller and Kyle Gallner.

programme.title: Teach My Pet to Do That
programme.desc: Animal lover, comedian and presenter Alexander Armstrong opens the doors of his multispecies pet training school, greeting Kevin the chow chow dog and Rambo the miniature New Zealand kunekune pig, to see if they can be taught to beg, spin and roll over. This week's star pet is Pudsey, the first dog to win Britain's Got Talent and which died recently. Plus, the show's trainers hit the road to see if they can train two chickens to play the world's most unusual game of Celebrity Guess Who by attempting to pick out the faces of Ant McPartlin and Katie Price from a constellation of stars.

programme.title: Ainsley's Caribbean Kitchen
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott takes a tour of Tobago, where he puts his own spin on some local recipes, including hand clapped rotis, dougla rum chicken, mustard fish and mango chili chow, and a bluewater breeze cocktail. He also helps Charlottesville fishermen to bring in the day's catch and takes a relaxing boat trip to the Nylon Pool.

programme.title: Living on the Veg
programme.desc: Henry Firth and Ian Theasby serve up crispy party poppers with barbecue dipping sauce - ideal for movie nights - a breakfast burrito, aubergine curry and banana bread doughnuts. They are also joined by Prue Leith, who tucks into their mushroom wellington.

programme.title: The Greek Islands with Julia Bradbury
programme.desc: Known as the Paradise Islands, the Sporades' lush pine forests and coastlines are simply breathtaking. On Skiathos, Julia boards a fishing boat in search of a secret world of hidden coves and deserted beaches. Heading inland, she visits the hillside Monastery of Evangelistria, one of Greece's most important religious sites, before island-hopping to neighbouring Skopelos for a taste of marriage, Greek style. After trying on the island's traditional wedding dress, her trip ends at the tiny Chapel of St John.

programme.title: Countrywise
programme.desc: Liz Bonnin enjoys one of Britain's National Trails as she walks part of the Thames Path through Oxfordshire - meeting some of the people and animals who call the banks of this impressive river home. Ben Fogle is in Whitby on the North Yorkshire coast to follow one of the nation's favourite dishes - fish and chips - from sea to plate. The programme also catches up with Dales shepherdess Amanda Owen as her family celebrates dad Clive's birthday.

programme.title: The Voice UK
programme.desc: Spinning-chair singing contest, in which celebrity 'coaches' seek out the nation's best vocal talent. But there is a simple twist - with the four coaches selecting their teams through 'blind auditions', looks play no part in the selection process, meaning each singer is chosen on vocal ability alone.

programme.title: The Masked Singer
programme.desc: Joel Dommett hosts a special double elimination show, in which two more singers will be unmasked. programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Ann Widdecombe, Sam Nixon and Mark Rhodes and Jimmy Carr pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: Dancing on Ice
programme.desc: The celebrities and their professional partners perform fairy-tale routines, hoping to get a high enough score from the judges and viewers to keep them out of the bottom two. Sadly there'll be no happy ever after for Radzi Chinyanganya, who lost the skate-off last week, but while the votes are being counted there will be a routine from Disney on Ice. Presented by Phillip Schofield and Holly Willoughby.

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: Wealthy betting shop tycoon Alun Wilmott is shot and killed during a home invasion, leaving his wife and daughter traumatised - with large amounts of cash missing from his personal safe, it is assumed he is the unlucky victim of a burglary. Vera suspects an inside job in the shape of Alun's head of private security, Ciaran Duggan, whose history of violent crime calls his reformed character into question. Can the team find the evidence to pin the crime on their prime suspect - or are they looking in the wrong place? Brenda Blethyn stars, with guest appearances from Karl Collins, Patrick Robinson and Katy Carmichael.

programme.title: Bradley Walsh & Son: Breaking Dad
programme.desc: The Chase presenter Bradley Walsh and his son Barney return for a second series as they embark on another road trip across America together. This time, the actor and his son arrive in Ohio, where they head for Dayton - the birthplace of aviation - before the pair attend a local rodeo later that evening. Brad soon realises that they are not just there to spectate on the sport, they are also expected to take part. However, a nasty fall from an angry bull means Brad spends the rest of the night in hospital.

programme.title: Six Nations Highlights
programme.desc: England v France. Jill Douglas presents action from both teams' opening match of the championship, which came from Stade de France. The hosts were looking to get off to a winning start under new head coach Fabien Galthie, while England were aiming to build on their run to last year's World Cup final. Plus, action from Wales v Italy at Principality Stadium and Ireland v Scotland at Aviva Stadium. With analysis from Jim Hamilton, Ugo Moyne, Gareth Thomas and Gordon D'Arcy, and commentary by Miles Harrison and Nick Mullins.

programme.title: Liar
programme.desc: Laura travels to Edinburgh to try to uncover the truth behind Andrew's wife's death, but finds more than she bargained for. Meanwhile, tensions between Tom and Katy reach breaking point as their secret threatens to surface. Thriller, starring Joanne Froggatt and Ioan Gruffudd.

programme.title: Liar
programme.desc: Laura's resolve to bring Andrew to justice deepens and she enlists Tom's help in her plan. However, when a deception in her personal life comes to light, she is left with no one to turn to and resorts to dangerous methods to force Andrew's confession. But she is not alone in her mission. Thriller, starring Joanne Froggatt, Ioan Gruffudd and Warren Brown.

programme.title: The Metro: A Rail Life Story
programme.desc: A train breaks down in a tunnel near the Metro's busiest station, drawing attention to the fact that many of the vehicles in the Metro fleet are past their best. Track inspection supervisor Wayne has his work cut out repairing decaying sleepers which, if not quickly replaced, could cause a train derailment, and customer service manager Alan finds his quiet night in rudely interrupted when he is called into work to deal with an outbreak of anti-social behaviour.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The Midsomer Museum of the Family is packed with visitors to see a collection of miniature dolls houses donated by a real estate mogul - only for the businessman to be shot dead in front of the crowd. Barnaby's investigation uncovers evidence of unsafe living conditions for the victim's tenants that would have given plenty of people a reason to kill - as well as a mysterious death that a man was imprisoned for, despite protesting his innocence. Guest starring Joanna Page, Katy Brand and Eleanor Bron.

programme.title: White House Farm
programme.desc: The funerals approach, and without the answers he needs and still more questions being thrown up from White House Farm, Stan's efforts remain fruitless. When all looks lost for Stan and Mick solving the case, a vital witness comes forward. Six-part drama based on the true story of the mass murder of a family in an Essex farmhouse in August 1985, providing a fresh insight into the tragic events. programme.title: James Martin's French Adventure
programme.desc: The celebrated chef arrives in the Dordogne, famous for its traditional hearty cuisine, buried treasures and a love of all things duck. Exploring the region, James tastes three local specialities all cooked for him by the Auberge owner, British ex-pat Chris. After lunch, Chris hunts for another local icon, the black truffle, which he intends to use in his next recipe.

programme.desc: Bradley is on the mend following his rodeo injury and determined to get back behind the wheel of the RV. Later, Bradley and Barney take the RV on a small cargo ferry as they head to Vermont. Here, the pair have a go at ice climbing, which proves treacherous for them and the crew, before a spot of dog sledding through the frozen wilderness and an inevitable race through the forests.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Eileen quizzes Brian and Cathy about Yasmeen's supposed drink problem, while Roy and Carla are worried to discover Nina moved out of her flat weeks ago. Sally looks over Tim's divorce papers and is then bemused to find a mock-up invitation for her own wedding.
